intro: Erica viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Erica viridiflora typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal and Mediterranean climates.
